tuv.seg: • Setting down for trial
• Triail a chur síos
In the High Court, the person who is bringing the case, that is, the person who is suing, is known as the plaintiff
San Ard-Chúirt, tugtar an gearánaí ar an duine a bhfuil tús á chur acu leis an gcás, is é sin, an duine a bhfuil agairt á dhéanamh acu
The person who is being sued is known as the defendant
Tugtar an cosantóir ar an duine a bhfuil agairt á dhéanamh orthu
To commence proceedings, that is, to start a legal action, the plaintiff's barrister prepares an originating summons
Chun tús a chur le himeachtaí, is é sin, chun tús a chur le caingean dlí, ullmhaíonn abhcóide an ghearánaí toghairm thionscnaimh
The purpose of this document is to state the case being made against the defendant
Is é cuspóir na cáipéise seo chun an cás atá á dhéanamh i leith an chosantóra a lua
When the defendant receives the summons, they must enter an appearance to show that they are now a party to the case
Nuair a fhaigheann an cosantóir an toghairm, ní mór dóibh láithreas a thaifeadadh lena thaispeáint gur páirtí anois iad sa chás
Depending on the type of originating summons, the plaintiff may have to serve a statement of claim on the defendant
Ag brath ar shaghas na toghairme tionscnaimh, b’fhéidir go mbeidh ar an ngearánaí ráitis éilimh a sheirbheáil ar an gcosantóir
When the defendant has received the statement of claim, they will issue a defence, setting out why the defendant is not to blame
Nuair a bhíonn an ráiteas éilimh faighte ag an gcosantóir, eiseoidh siad cosaint, ina leagtar amach cén fáth nach bhfuil an locht ar an gcosantóir
If the defendant believes that they actually have a claim against the plaintiff, the defendant will include a counterclaim with the defence setting out their claim against the plaintiff

Má chreideann an cosantóir go dtarlaíonn go bhfuil éileamh acu i gcoinne an ghearánaí, cuirfidh an cosantóir frithéileamh san áireamh leis an gcosaint ina leagtar amach a n-éileamh i leith an ghearánaí
Usually proceedings in the High Court are commenced by an originating summons
De ghnáth, cuirtear tús le himeachtaí san Ard-Chúirt le toghairm thionscnaimh
After the summons has been prepared by your barrister, your solicitor takes it to the Central Office to be issued - this involves paying the stamp duty
I ndiaidh gur ullmhaigh d’abhcóide an toghairm, tabharfaidh d’aturnae í chuig an Lároifig go n-eiseofar í – is gá an dleacht stampála a íoc mar chuid de seo
After the stamp duty has been paid, the summons is stamped and it is ready to be served on the defendant
I ndiaidh go n-íoctar an dleacht stampála, stampáiltear an toghairm agus bíonn sí réidh le seirbheáil ar an gcosantóir
There is more information in Order 5 of the Rules of the Superior Courts
Tá níos mó faisnéise ar fáil in Ordú 5 de Rialacha na nUaschúirteanna
There are 3 types of originating summons:
Tá 3 shaghas de thoghairm thionscnaimh ann:
• A plenary summons is used to commence proceedings where there is a real dispute between the parties and/or the amount of the plaintiff's claim is not specific or easy to calculate
• Úsáidtear toghairm iomlánach chun tús a chur le himeachtaí nuair atá fíor-dhíospóid idir na páirtithe agus/nó mura mbíonn méid éileamh an ghearánaí sonrach nó furasta le ríomh
For example, a plenary summons may be used where the plaintiff claims that they were injured in a road traffic accident due to the defendant's negligence
Mar shampla, féadtar toghairm iomlánach a úsáid nuair a mhaíonn an gearánaí gur gortaíodh iad i dtimpiste um thrácht ar bhóithre mar gheall ar fhaillí an chosantóra
When a plenary summons is issued, the next step is for the parties to exchange pleadings (see statement of claim and delivering the defence below)
Nuair a eisítear toghairm iomlánach, is í an chéad chéim eile do na páirtithe chun pléadálacha a mhalartú (féach ‘ráiteas éilimh’ agus ‘an chosaint a sholáthar’ thíos)
Eventually, the case will be given a date for a trial and there may be evidence given by witnesses
Ar deireadh, tabharfar dáta trialach don chás agus féadfaidh finnéithe fianaise a thabhairt
• A summary summons is used when the amount of the plaintiff's claim is easily quantifiable and the defendant does not have any valid defence
• Úsáidtear toghairm iomlánach nuair atá méid éileamh an ghearánaí furasta le cainníochtú agus nuair nach mbíonn aon chosaint bhailí ag an gcosantóir
For example, a summary summons may be used where the plaintiff claims that they lent the defendant a specific amount of money that has not been repaid
Mar shampla, is féidir toghairm iomlánach a úsáid nuair a mhaíonn an gearánaí gur thug siad suim shonrach airgid ar iasacht don chosantóir nár aisíoc siad
Summary proceedings do not involve pleadings and do not end in a trial with evidence given by witnesses
Níl pléadálacha i gceist le himeachtaí achomair agus ní chríochnaítear iad le triail ina dtugann finnéithe fianaise
It is a fast-track procedure where the judge decides the case after reading affidavits submitted by both sides
Is nós imeachta mear é ina ndéanann an breitheamh cinneadh ar an gcás i ndiaidh mionnscríbhinní a sheol an dá thaobh isteach
However, if it becomes clear to the judge that the defendant has a stateable defence to the claim, the judge may order that the case be dealt with as plenary proceedings
Más soiléir don bhreitheamh go bhfuil cosaint inluaite ag an gcosantóir leis an éileamh, féadfaidh an breitheamh a ordú go ndéileálfar leis an gcás mar imeachtaí iomlánacha
This means that pleadings will be exchanged and the matter may go to trial
Ciallaíonn seo go ndéanfar pléadálacha a mhalartú agus go bhféadfadh an cheist triail a bhaint amach
• A special summons is used for cases that involve pure issues of law or very specific issues of fact
• Úsáidtear toghairm speisialta do chásanna ina bhfuil saincheisteanna glana dlí nó saincheisteanna an-ghlana fírice i gceist
For example, a special summons will be issued to commence a claim relating to the administration of the estate of a deceased person
Mar shampla, eiseofar toghairm speisialta chun tús a chur le héileamh a bhaineann le riar eastát duine éagtha
Like summary proceedings, this is a fast-track procedure where the judge decides the case by reading affidavits submitted by both sides
Ar nós imeachtaí iomlánacha, is nós imeachta mear seo ina ndéanann an breitheamh cinneadh ar an gcás trí mhionnscríbhinní a léamh a sheolann an dá thaobh isteach
There is more information on originating summons on the Courts Service website
Tá fáil ar bhreis faisnéise ar thoghairmeacha tionscnaimh ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna
All originating summonses must contain the following information:
Ní mór an fhaisnéis a leanas a bheith cuimsithe i ngach toghairm thionscnaimh:
• A title – the plaintiff's name and the defendant's name make up the title of the proceedings
• Teideal – comhdhéanann ainm an ghearánaí agus ainm an chosantóra teideal na n-imeachtaí
• The type of the summons, for example, plenary summons
• Saghas na toghairme, mar shampla, toghairm iomlánach
• A description of the parties – the summons must state the surname, first name, the residence or place of business and the occupation of the plaintiff
• Cur síos ar na páirtithe – ní mór go luafar sa toghairm sloinne, céadainm, áit chónaithe nó áit ghnó agus gairm an ghearánaí
It must also state the name and address of the defendant (or their solicitor)
Chomh maith leis sin, ní mór go luafar ainm agus seoladh an chosantóra (nó a n-aturnae)
• An indorsement of claim – this is the part of the summons that sets out what the plaintiff claims they are entitled to
• Formhuiniú éilimh – tá seo mar chuid den toghairm ina leagtar amach an méid a mhaíonn an gearánaí atá siad i dteideal a fháil
The level of detail necessary in this section depends on the type of summons
Braitheann an méid sonraí a theastaíonn sa mhír seo ar shaghas na toghairme

If the summons is a plenary summons, it is only necessary to give the defendant information about the general nature of the plaintiff's claim – more detail will be provided in the statement of claim that follows
Más toghairm iomlánach an toghairm, ní gá ach faisnéis a thabhairt don chosantóir faoi chineál ginearálta éileamh an ghearánaí – soláthrófar níos mó sonraí sa ráiteas éilimh a leanfaidh sin
If the summons is a summary summons or a special summons, much more detail must be given about the nature, extent and grounds of the plaintiff's claim against the defendant
Más toghairm iomlánach nó toghairm speisialta an toghairm, ní mór i bhfad níos mó sonraí a thabhairt faoi chineál, méid agus bunúis éileamh an ghearánaí i leith an chosantóra
It should clearly set out the allegations that are being made by the plaintiff and the amount that the plaintiff claims they are entitled to
Ba cheart go leagfaí amach go soiléir na líomhaintí atá á ndéanamh ag an ngearánaí agus an méid a mhaíonn an gearánaí go bhfuil siad i dteideal a fháil
Serving an originating summons
Toghairm thionscnaimh a sheirbheáil
To serve an originating summons, a copy of the summons must be handed to the defendant and they must be shown the original
Chun toghairm thionscnaimh a sheirbheáil, ní mór cóip den toghairm a thabhairt don chosantóir agus ní mór dóibh an bhunchóip a thaispeáint dóibh
The summons can be served on the defendant's solicitor if they accept service on behalf of their client and is authorised to do so
Féadtar an toghairm a sheirbheáil ar aturnae an chosantóra má ghlacann siad le seirbheáil a dhéanamh thar ceann a gcliaint agus má tá siad údaraithe chun amhlaidh a dhéanamh
There is more information on serving a summons in Order 9 of the Rules of the Superior Courts
Tá níos mó faisnéise ar thoghairm a sheirbheáil in Ordú 9 de Rialacha na nUaschúirteanna
When a defendant receives a plenary or a summary summons they should enter an appearance within 8 days
Sa chás go bhfaigheann cosantóir toghairm iomlánach nó achomair, ba cheart dóibh láithreas a thaifeadadh laistigh de 8 lá
This time limit is not strict and in most cases, an appearance can be entered after the time has expired
Níl an teorainn ama dian agus, i dtromlach na gcásanna, féadtar láithreas a iontráil i ndiaidh gur éag an t-am
When a defendant receives a special summons they may enter an appearance at any time
Sa chás go bhfaigheann cosantóir toghairm speisialta, féadfaidh siad láithreas a thaifeadadh ag aon tráth
They will not be heard at any proceedings unless they have entered an appearance
Ní éistfear leo ag aon imeachtaí murar iontráil siad láithreas
Entering an appearance is a very important step as it indicates that the defendant intends to defend the proceedings
Céim an-tábhachtach is ea láithreas a thaifeadadh mar gheall go dtugann sé le fios go mbeartaíonn an cosantóir chun na himeachtaí a chosaint
To enter an appearance, the defendant must lodge a memorandum of appearance at the Central Office
Chun láithreas a thaifeadadh, ní mór don chosantóir meabhrán láithris a sheoladh ar aghaidh ag an Lároifig
The plaintiff's solicitor must then be notified by the defendant that an appearance has been entered
Ní mór don chosantóir fógra a thabhairt d’aturnae an ghearánaí ina dhiaidh sin gur iontráladh láithreas
The short form must contain the following information:
Ní mór go gcuimsítear an fhaisnéis a leanas san fhoirm ghearr:
• The name of the defendant's solicitor. If the defendant does not have a solicitor, it must state that the defendant defends in person
• Ainm aturnae an chosantóra Mura bhfuil aturnae ag an gcosantóir, ní mór go luafar ann go ndéanfaidh an cosantóir na himeachtaí a chosaint iad féin
• The form must also give the solicitor's address
• Ní mór seoladh an aturnae a thabhairt san fhoirm, chomh maith
If the defendant does not have a solicitor, it must state an address where documents can be left for them
Mura bhfuil aturnae ag an gcosantóir, ní mór go luafar seoladh ann inar féidir cáipéisí a fhágáil dóibh
Further information on entering an appearance is available in Order 12 of the Rules of the Superior Courts
Tá fáil ar thuilleadh faisnéise ar láithreas a iontráil in Ordú 12 de Rialacha na nUaschúirteanna
If the case has been commenced by a plenary summons and the defendant has entered an appearance, then the next step is for the plaintiff to serve a statement of claim on the defendant
Má cuireadh tús leis an gcás trí thoghairm iomlánach agus má d’iontráil an cosantóir láithreas, is é an chéad chéim ná go seirbheálfaidh an gearánaí ráiteas éilimh ar an gcosantóir
The plaintiff has 21 days to deliver the statement of claim after the defendant has entered an appearance
Tugtar 21 lá don ghearánaí chun an ráiteas éilimh a sholáthar i ndiaidh gur iontráil an cosantóir láithreas
If the plaintiff fails to deliver the statement of claim within the required time, the defendant can apply to the court to dismiss the action for want of prosecution

Má theipeann ar an ngearánaí an ráiteas éilimh a iontráil laistigh den tráth a theastaíonn, féadfaidh an cosantóir iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gcúirt chun an caingean a dhíbhe d’fhonn ionchúiseamh a dhéanamh
It is not necessary to serve the statement of claim personally on the defendant – it may be sent by registered post
Ní gá an ráiteas éilimh a sheirbheáil go pearsanta ar an gcosantóir – is féidir é a sheoladh sa phost cláraithe
The purpose of the statement of claim is to show the defendant the case that is being made against them and which they have to meet at the trial of the action
Is é cuspóir an ráitis éilimh an cás a thaispeáint don chosantóir atá á dhéanamh ina leith agus an cás a mbeidh orthu aghaidh a thabhairt air ag triail na caingne
The statement of claim must contain the following information:
Ní mór an fhaisnéis a leanas a bheith cuimsithe sa ráiteas éilimh:
• The title and record number – the plaintiff's name and the defendant's name make up the title of the proceedings
• An teideal agus an uimhir thaifid – comhdhéanann ainm an ghearánaí agus ainm an chosantóra teideal na n-imeachtaí
• A description of the parties – the statement of claim must state the surname, first name, the residence or place of business and the occupation of the plaintiff and the defendant
• Cur síos ar na páirtithe – ní mór go luafar sa ráiteas éilimh sloinne, céadainm, áit chónaithe nó áit ghnó agus gairm an ghearánaí agus an chosantóra
• The statement of claim must state the nature, extent and grounds of the plaintiff's claim against the defendant
• Ní mór go luafar sa ráiteas éilimh cineál, méid agus bunúis éileamh an ghearánaí i leith an chosantóra
It should clearly set out the allegations that are being made by the plaintiff and the damage that the plaintiff suffered
Ba cheart go leagfaí amach go soiléir na líomhaintí atá á ndéanamh ag an ngearánaí agus an díobháil a raibh an gearánaí thíos léi
It should also state what the plaintiff is seeking from the court
Anuas air sin, ba cheart go luafaí cad atá á lorg ag an ngearánaí ón gcúirt
• The statement of claim must be dated and signed by the plaintiff or their solicitor
• Ní mór don ráiteas éilimh a bheith dátaithe agus sínithe ag an ngearánaí nó ag a n-aturnae
Further information is available in Order 20 of the Rules of the Superior Courts
Tá fáil ar thuilleadh faisnéise in Ordú 20 de Rialacha na nUaschúirteanna
The defendant must deliver a defence to the plaintiff and they must deliver the defence within 28 days of receiving the statement of claim
Ní mór don chosantóir cosaint a sholáthar don ghearánaí agus ní mór dóibh an chosaint a sholáthar laistigh de 28 lá tar éis an ráiteas éilimh a fháil
This time limit is not strict and in most cases, a defence can be delivered after the time has expired
Níl an teorainn ama seo dian agus, i dtromlach na gcásanna, féadtar cosaint a sholáthar i ndiaidh gur éag an t-am

When they receive the statement of claim they may decide that not only have they done nothing wrong and the claim should not have been brought against them, but that they have a claim against the plaintiff

Nuair a fhaigheann siad an ráiteas éilimh, féadfaidh siad a chinneadh ní hamháin nach ndearna siad aon rud mícheart agus nár cheart an t-éileamh a dhéanamh ina choinne, ach go bhfuil éileamh acu i gcoinne an ghearánaí
In those circumstances, they may wish to include a counterclaim with their defence
Faoi na cúinsí siúd, b’fhéidir gur mian leo frithéileamh a chur san áireamh lena gcosaint
There are no set rules about what must be contained in the defence
Níl aon rialacha seasta ann maidir leis an méid ar cheart a chuimsiú sa chosaint
The document starts with the title of the proceedings and the record number
Tosaítear an cháipéis le teideal na n-imeachtaí agus an uimhir thaifid
It is up to the defendant to admit or deny the allegations that the plaintiff has made in their statement of claim
Is faoin gcosantóir atá sé chun na líomhaintí a admháil nó a shéanadh a rinne an gearánaí ina ráiteas éilimh
It is also up to the defendant to state any specific defence that they are relying on
Anuas air sin, is faoin gcosantóir atá sé chun aon chosaint shonrach a lua a bhfuil siad ag brath uirthi
For example, if the defendant is claiming that the plaintiff's claim has been brought outside of the time limits, then the defendant should specifically plead that fact in the defence
Mar shampla, má tá mhaíonn an cosantóir go ndearnadh éileamh an ghearánaí lasmuigh de na teorainneacha ama, ba cheart don chosantóir an fhíric sin a phléadáil go sonrach sa chosaint
If the plaintiff has made a specific allegation and the defendant fails to deny that allegation in the defence, it will be assumed that the defendant is admitting that the allegation is true
Má rinne an gearánaí líomhain shonrach agus má theipeann ar an gcosantóir an líomhain sin a shéanadh sa chosaint, meastar go bhfuil an cosantóir ag admháil go bhfuil an líomhain fíor

For example, if the plaintiff has claimed in the statement of claim that they were involved in a road traffic accident and the defence fails to deny that the road traffic accident occurred, then it is assumed that the defendant is admitting that the road traffic accident happened

Mar shampla, má mhaíonn an gearánaí sa ráiteas éilimh go raibh baint ag an ngearánaí i dtimpiste um thrácht ar bhóithre agus má theipeann ar an gcosaint a shéanadh gur tharla an timpiste um thrácht ar bhóithre, meastar go bhfuil an cosantóir ag admháil gur tharla an timpiste um thrácht ar bhóithre
It is not then necessary for the plaintiff to prove to the judge that the accident occurred
Ní gá don ghearánaí a chruthú don bhreitheamh gur tharla an timpiste
On the other hand, when the defendant specifically denies a claim that the plaintiff has made, they are putting the plaintiff on proof of the allegation
Ar an taobh eile den phingin, nuair a shéanann an cosantóir go sonrach éileamh a rinne an gearánaí, cuirtear an gearánaí ar cruthúnas na líomhna
This means that the plaintiff must prove that the claim is true
Ciallaíonn seo nach mór don ghearánaí a chruthú go bhfuil an t-éileamh fíor
For example, if the defence specifically denies that the road traffic accident occurred, the plaintiff must prove it by introducing evidence in court
Mar shampla, má shéantar sa chosaint go sonrach gur tharla an timpiste um thrácht ar bhóithre, ní mór don ghearánaí a chruthú gur tharla sí trí fhianaise a thabhairt chun na cúirte
If the defendant wishes to make a claim against the plaintiff, this can be done by adding a counterclaim section to the defence
Más main leis an gcosantóir éileamh a dhéanamh i gcoinne an ghearánaí, féadtar seo a dhéanamh trí mhír frithéilimh a chur leis an gcosaint
This must clearly set out the allegations that the defendant is making against the plaintiff and what the defendant seeks from the court
Ní mór go leagtar amach go soiléir ann seo na líomhaintí atá á ndéanamh ag an gcosantóir i gcoinne an ghearánaí agus an méid atá á lorg ag an gcosantóir ón gcúirt
There is more information in Order 21 of the Rules of the Superior Courts
Tá níos mó faisnéise ar fáil in Ordú 21 de Rialacha na nUaschúirteanna
It is often necessary to reply to points raised in a defence
Is minic gur gá freagairt do phointí a thugtar chun solais i gcosaint
If the plaintiff wishes to deliver a reply, they must do so within 14 days of receiving the defence unless the time is extended by the Court
Más mian leis an ngearánaí freagairt a sholáthar, ní mór dóibh amhlaidh a dhéanamh laistigh de 14 lá tar éis an chosaint a fháil, mura síneann an Chúirt an méid ama
Where a counterclaim has been delivered by the defence, the reply is subject to the rules that apply to a defence
Sa chás gur sholáthair an chosaint frithéileamh, bíonn an fhreagairt faoi réir na rialacha a bhíonn i gceist le cosaint
Further information is available in Order 23 of the Rules of the Superior Courts
Tá fáil ar thuilleadh faisnéise in Ordú 23 de Rialacha na nUaschúirteanna
If the defendant fails to enter an appearance, the plaintiff can apply to court for judgement in default of appearance
Má theipeann ar an gcosantóir chun láithreas a thaifeadadh, féadfaidh an gearánaí iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gcúirt ar bhreithiúnas d’éagmais láithris

This means that because the defendant has failed to acknowledge the proceedings and indicate that they intend to defend them, the plaintiff may obtain a judgement from the court against the defendant without the need for a trial

Ciallaíonn seo gur theip ar an gcosantóir na himeachtaí a aithint agus a thabhairt le fios go mbeartaíonn siad iad a chosaint. Is féidir leis an ngearánaí breithiúnas a fháil ón gcúirt i leith an chosantóra gan aon ghá a bheith le triail
If the defendant fails to deliver a defence, the plaintiff can apply to Court for judgement in default of defence
Ciallaíonn seo gur theip ar an gcosantóir cosaint a sheoladh chuig an ngearánaí
This means that because the defendant has failed to send a defence to the plaintiff, the plaintiff may obtain a judgement from the court against the defendant without the need for a trial
Is féidir leis an ngearánaí breithiúnas a fháil ón gcúirt i leith an chosantóra gan aon ghá a bheith le triail
There is more information in Order 27 of the Rules of the Superior Courts
Tá níos mó faisnéise ar fáil in Ordú 27 de Rialacha na nUachúirteanna
Where either plaintiff or defendant is unsure of the case they have to meet, they can seek particulars
Sa chás nach mbíonn gearánaí nó cosantóir cinnte faoin gcás ar gá dóibh aghaidh a thabhairt air, féadfaidh siad sonraí a lorg
It is a request for more information about the case
Iarratas atá ann ar bhreis faisnéise faoin gcás
They can also seek further and better particulars about any matter stated in any pleading
Anuas air sin, féadfaidh siad sonraí breise agus níos fearr a lorg faoin aon cheist a luaitear in aon phléadáil
They can apply for the particulars by letter or seek an order from the Court
Féadfaidh siad iarratas a dhéanamh ar na sonraí trí litir nó féadfaidh siad ordú a lorg on gCúirt
Further information is available in Rules 7 and 8 of Order 19 of the Rules of the Superior Courts
Tá fáil ar thuilleadh faisnéise i Rialacha 7 agus 8 d’Ordú 19 de Rialacha na nUaschúirteanna
Setting down for trial
Triail a chur síos
In general, in actions commenced by plenary summons a notice of trial (Form 18 or 19) is served by the plaintiff on the defendant and is set down for trial in the Central Office
Go ginearálta, i gcaingne a gcuireann toghairm iomlánach tús leo, seirbheálann an gearánaí fógra trialach (Foirm 18 nó 19) ar an gcosantóir agus cuirtear síos é le haghaidh trialach sa Lár-Oifig
At least 21 days’ notice must be given, unless shorter notice has been agreed
Caithfear ar a laghad fógra 21 lá a thabhairt, mura ndearnadh comhaontú ar fhógra níos giorra
A motion to set aside the notice of trial must be brought within 4 days of the service of the notice
Caithfear rún chun fógra trialach a chur i leataobh a thabhairt laistigh de 4 lá i ndiaidh an fógra a sheirbheáil

If the plaintiff does not give notice of trial within 6 weeks after the close of the pleadings, or within such extended time as the Court may allow, the defendant may give notice of trial or may apply to the Court to dismiss the action for want of prosecution

Mura dtugann an gearánaí fógra trialach laistigh de 6 seachtaine i ndiaidh go dtugtar na pléadálacha chun críche, nó laistigh den am sínte sin a cheadóidh an Chúirt, féadfaidh an cosantóir fógra trialach a thabhairt nó iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gCúirt chun an chaingean a dhíbhe mar gheall ar easpa ionchúisimh
Notice of trial is given before setting down the action for trial
Tugtar fógra trialach sula ndéantar an chaingean a chur síos le haghaidh trialach
If the action is not set down by either party within 14 days of notice of trial being served, the notice of trial will no longer be in force
Mura gcuireann ceachtar páirtí an chaingean síos laistigh de 14 lá i ndiaidh gur seirbheáiltear an fógra trialach, ní bheidh an fógra trialach i bhfeidhm a thuilleadh

The party setting down the proceedings for trial does so by delivering to the Central Office a copy of the notice of trial together with 2 copies of the whole of the pleadings (and of any letter or notice for particulars and reply to it), one of which is for the use of the judge at the trial

Déanann an páirtí a chuireann na himeachtaí le haghaidh trialach síos amhlaidh trí chóip a sholáthar don Lár-Oifig den fhógra trialach, anuas ar 2 chóip de na pléadálacha iomlána (agus d’aon litir nó fógra do chritéir agus aon fhreagra a tugadh orthu), agus úsáidfidh an breitheamh cóip amháin díobh ag an triail
Further information is available in Order 36 of the Rules of the Superior Courts
Tá fáil ar thuilleadh faisnéise in Ordú 36 de Rialacha na nUaschúirteanna
When the case is set down for trial, it is assigned to the relevant listing for the type of case
Nuair a cuireadh an cás síos le haghaidh trialach, sanntar é don liostú ábhartha i dtaobh shaghas an cháis
Information on listing procedures is available on the Courts Service website
Tá faisnéis ar nósanna imeachta liostaithe ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna
The stamp duty that must be paid when a summons is issued is €190
Is ionann an dleacht stampála nach mór a íoc nuair a eisítear toghairm agus €190
The stamp duty for entering an appearance is €60
Is é an dleacht stampála atá le híoc chun láithreas a thaifeadadh €60
There is no fee or stamp duty for lodging a defence
Ní ghearrtar aon táille nó dleacht stampála ar chosaint a sheoladh ar aghaidh
Further information on High Court fees is available on the Courts Service website
Tá fáil ar bhreis faisnéise ar tháillí na hArd-Chúirte ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna
Your solicitor and barrister will also charge fees for their services
Gearrfaidh d’aturnae agus d’abhcóide táillí ar a gcuid seirbhísí
Further information on High Court procedures, High Court rules and forms is available on the Courts Service website
Tá fáil ar bhreis faisnéise ar nósanna imeachta na hArd-Chúirte, rialacha na hArd-Chúirte agus ar fhoirmeacha ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna
